intro: Randia clathrodendron, commonly known as the clustered randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically opposite, oval-shaped, and have a smooth texture. Randia clathrodendron is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
